perturbation.original_text: For calendar year 2016, the Franchise Fee shall be paid to Grantor on or before March 31, 2017.
perturbation.changed_text: For calendar year 2016, the Franchise Fee shall be paid to Grantor on or before June 30, 2017.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by altering the payment deadline for the franchise fee for the year 2016. The original text specifies March 31, 2017, while the modified text indicates June 30, 2017. This creates uncertainty as to when the payment is actually due, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
For each calendar year during the term of this Franchise, Grantor’s percentage share shall be determined
pursuant to this Section, and paid to Grantor on or before March 31 of the succeeding calendar year.
perturbation.changed_text:
For each calendar year during the term of this Franchise, Grantor’s percentage share shall be determined
pursuant to this Section, and paid to Grantor within 90 days of the end of the calendar year.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction in the payment deadline for the franchise fee. Originally, the fee was due on or before March 31st of the succeeding year. The revised clause states the payment is due within 90 days of the end of the calendar year. This creates ambiguity about the actual due date and could result in disagreements.

perturbation.original_text:
Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the
Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least forty (40) hours per week for the conduct of business between
Grantee and its customers.
perturbation.changed_text:
Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the
Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least twenty (20) hours per week, with the option to conduct business remotely for the remainder of the 40 hours.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces an inconsistency by changing the required minimum hours of operation for the business office. The original text mandates 40 hours per week, while the changed text reduces it to 20 hours with a possibility of remote operation for the remaining hours. This contradiction makes it unclear what the actual operational requirement is and opens the door to disputes about compliance.
